column5: • Covid19 India Outbreak 2024 – Active Cases, Update Today, Start Date

column5: Covid19 India Outbreak 2024 – Active Cases, Update Today, Start Date

column1: The COVID-19 pandemic in India is part of the global pandemic caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus. As of 19 August 2024, India had recorded 45,041,748 instances of COVID-19 infection. The first cases were documented on 30 January 2020, in Kerala. A second wave that started in March 2021 was more destructive than the first, causing shortages of medical supplies including vaccines, oxygen cylinders, and medical beds. On 16th January 2021, India launched its vaccination campaign using the local Covaxin and the AstraZeneca vaccine (Covishield). India topped the globe in both new and active cases by the end of April 2021. India declared on 30th January 2022, that over 720 million individuals had received all recommended vaccinations, with over 1.7 billion doses having been given. It was made compulsory for Indians to get the 2 doses of the COVID-19 vaccination which were available in all the private and government-headed hospitals. Read the article further to know about the details of Covid19 India Outbreak 2024 and its state-wise active cases.

A proportion of the worldwide COVID-19 pandemic brought on by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus is affecting India. 45,041,748 cases of COVID-19 infection have been reported in India as of 19th August 2024. In Kerala, the first instance was documented on 30 January 2020. In March 2021, a second wave that was more damaging than the first broke out, leading to shortages of medical supplies such as oxygen cylinders, medical beds, and vaccines. India’s immunization program, which uses the AstraZeneca vaccine (Covishield) and the regional Covaxin, was started on 16th January 2021. By the end of April 2021, India led the world in both new and active cases. On 30th January 2022, India reported that over 720 million people had got all advised immunizations, totalling over 1.7 billion doses. The COVID-19 immunization, which comes in two doses and is available in both government-run and private facilities, is now required for Indian citizens. Continue reading to learn more about the Covid-19 India Outbreak 2024 and the active cases that are currently being reported per state.
Overview Of COVID-19 India Outbreak 2024 Start Date
The arrival of COVID-19 in India in 2019 – 2020 Start Date
• India announced its first incidence of COVID-19 in Thrissur, Kerala, on 30th January 2020.

• By 3rd February 2020, there were three instances in India, all of which were students returning from Wuhan. Other than this, there was no discernible increase in transmissions in February 2020. New twenty-two cases, including 14 infected members of an Italian tourist group, were announced on 4th March 2020.
• As more people with a history of travel to the impacted countries and their contacts tested positive, the number of transmissions grew over the months.

• After attending a Sikh festival in Anandpur Sahib from 10-12 March 2020, a Sikh preacher became a super spreader of COVID-19, leading to over 40,000 individuals in 20 Punjabi villages being quarantined on 27 March 2020.
• The Tablighi Jamaat religious gathering in Delhi also contributed to the spread. Additionally, 4,000 pilgrims returning from Nanded, Maharashtra, and 27 bus drivers and conductors tested positive.
• Antibody testing in July 2020 suggested that 57% of those in Mumbai’s slums might have been infected. This led to the arrival of COVID-19 in India.
• India began vaccinating people on 16th January 2021, almost a year after the country’s first COVID-19 case was reported.
• On 19th January 2021, Lakshadweep reported its first case, making it the final Indian area to do so.

• By February 2021, the number of cases per day had decreased to 9,000. But by the beginning of April 2021, a serious second wave of diseases had spread throughout the country, with disastrous results.
• India’s number of active cases reached one million on 9th April 2021, and on 12th April 2021, it surpassed Brazil to become the nation with the second-highest number of COVID-19 cases worldwide.
• By the end of April, India had over 2.5 million active cases, with an average of 2,000 deaths and 300,000 new cases reported daily.
• There were concerns that these figures were underestimated.
• On 30th April 2021, India recorded more than 3,500 fatalities and over 400,000 new cases in a single day.
• This led to a stop in all public gatherings and a lockdown with utmost strictness.
• In March 2022, India had 22,487 COVID-19 cases nationwide.
• With 70% of the population having received at least one vaccine dose and 58.8% fully vaccinated, the country is progressing towards post-pandemic reopening.
• The immunisation program in 2022 included children aged 12 to 15.
• State governments have been asked to remove most COVID restrictions, except for social distancing and masks. International flights resumed on 27 March 2022 after a two-year hiatus.
• Prime Minister Modi called a meeting on 22nd March 2023, to discuss the country’s readiness for a potential new wave of infections caused by the SARS-CoV-2 strain XBB.1.16.
• As of 23rd March, there was a 5-month high in active cases, coinciding with an ongoing H3N2 influenza outbreak.
• Due to the increasing number of patients, many hospitals have reopened their Covid wards.
• In August, a new Omicron subvariant called Eris was discovered in Maharashtra, with cases reported in several locations.
